questions.question: In what children's game are participants chased by someone designated "It"?
On a radio, stations are changed by using what control?
Which state in the United States is largest by area?
What is Aurora Borealis commonly known as?
Galileo was an Italian astronomer who:
answer: Discovered that the movement of pendulum produces a regular time measurement

questions.question: Exposure to sunlight helps a person improve his health because:
answer: The infrared light kills bacteria in the body
The pigment cells in the skin get stimulated and produce a healthy tan
The ultraviolet rays convert skin oil into Vitamin D

questions.question: Sir Thomas Fearnley Cup is awarded to:
answer: A club or a local sport association for remarkable achievements
Amateur athlete, not necessarily an Olympian
National Olympic Committee for outstanding work

questions.question: When did Margaret Thatcher became the first female Prime Minister of Britain?
When is the International Workers' Day?
When did China test their first atomic device?
When did Commander Robert Peary discover the North Pole?
What is the population density of Kerala?
What is the range of missile 'Akash'?
